definition: alchemist/necromancer

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
surname Fang
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
surname Shi

sentences.english: But that square private, would be legendary Xu Fu?
sentences.chinese: 而那個方士，便是傳說中的徐福？

sentences.english: For the alchemists and the Six Dynasties'novels, previous studies have been on a lot.
sentences.chinese: 對於方士和六朝小說，前人已有很多的研究論著。

sentences.english: City Xu Fuzhen, known as the Xu Xiang County, the hometown of Xu Fu for the alchemist.
sentences.chinese: 龍口徐福鎮，古稱徐鄉縣，爲秦朝方士徐福故里。

sentences.english: In fact, in this era the alchemists indeed reached the top of their career.
sentences.chinese: 事實上在這個時代，方士也的確等到了他們的春天。

sentences.english: A plenty of images of alchemists appeared in the novels in Six Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 在這種條件漢魏六朝小說中出現了大量方士形象。

sentences.english: 13 Eunuchs and officials made up the largest army of ‘alchemists’ in the mid-Ming.
sentences.chinese: 明朝中葉，宦官和官僚構建了龐大的“方士”集團。

definition: arts of healing, divination, horoscope etc/supernatural arts (old)
Xu Fu (3rd century BC), Qin dynasty court necromancer
legendary magic potion of immortals/panacea/fig. wonder solution to a problem
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
Ge Hong (283-363), Jin dynasty Daoist and alchemist, author of 抱樸子|抱朴子[Bao4 pu3 zi3]
Confucian scholar (old)
Qin Shihuang (259-210 BC), the first emperor
witchcraft
Qin Yueren (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills
Zhang Jue (-184), leader of the Yellow turban rebels during the late Han
fortune-teller who uses the subject's face for his prognostication
School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Zou Yan 鄒衍|邹衍[Zou1 Yan3]
grand scribe (official position in many Chinese states up to the Han)
immortality
shaman/wizard/witch
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
